violation.title: The composer.lock is not up to date.
violation.message: The lock file is not up to date with the latest changes in composer.json. You may be getting outdated dependencies. Run update to update them.

violation.title: Text files should end with a newline character
violation.message: This file ends with no newline character. It won't render properly on a terminal, and it's considered a bad practice. Add a simple line feed as the last character to fix it.

violation.title: Commented code should not be committed
violation.message: Commented out code reduces readability and lowers the code confidence for other developers. If it's common usage for debug, it should not be committed. Using a version control system, such code can be safely removed.

violation.title: Unused method, property, variable or parameter
violation.message: This rootNode local variable is declared but never used. You should remove it.

violation.title: Unused method, property, variable or parameter
violation.message: This config local variable is declared but never used. You should remove it.

violation.title: Unused use statement should be avoided
violation.message: The class Symfony\Component\ClassLoader\ApcClassLoader is declared but never used. You should remove the use statement.
violation.context:
<?php

use Symfony\Component\ClassLoader\ApcClassLoader;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;

$loader = require_once __DIR__.'/../app/bootstrap.php.cache';

// Enable APC for autoloading to improve performance.

violation.title: Sensitive data should not be present in non-parameter configuration files
violation.message: A sensitive data has been detected in your configuration file (username parameter). You should consider storing it in a single parameter file.
violation.context: stop: 10500 ssh: host: null port: null private_key_path: null username: vagrant guest_port: null keep_alive: true forward_agent: false forward_x11: false shell: 'bash -l'

violation.title: Sensitive data should not be present in non-parameter configuration files

violation.context: - 'APP_ENV dev' proxies: { } apache: install: '1' settings: user: vagrant group: vagrant default_vhost: true manage_user: false manage_group: false sendfile: 0

violation.title: Symfony2 secret should be changed
violation.message: The secret is the default one from the Symfony Standard Edition

violation.title: Default session cookie's name should be changed.
violation.message: The session cookie name is the default one, PHPSESSID. You should consider overwriting it thanks to session.name parameter (see the official documentation).

violation.title: A route should always have a valid HTTP method
violation.message: The route "_index" should have a routing method (GET/POST/PUT). It is mandatory.

violation.title: A route should always have a valid HTTP method
violation.message: The route "homepage" should have a routing method (GET/POST/PUT). It is mandatory.

violation.title: Symfony applications should not contain a config.php file
violation.message: This config.php file should only be used to bootstrap a Symfony application. Before releasing to production, you should remove it, otherwise attackers could get valuable insight about your application.

violation.title: Source code should not contain FIXME comments
violation.message: FIXME comments are left in the code when a bug has been noticed but not fixed. You should fix the bug and remove the comment.

violation.title: Source code should not contain TODO comments
violation.message: TODO comments are left in the code when a feature (or a bug) isn't completely developed (or fixed). You should complete the implementation and remove the comment.

violation.title: Default favicon should be changed
violation.message: Default Apple touch Symfony2 favicon found. This reveals the backend engine of the application and makes it more vulnerable to attackers. Consider using a custom favicon instead - plus, your users will memorize your application more easily.

violation.title: Default favicon should be changed
violation.message: Default default HiDPI Symfony2 favicon found. This reveals the backend engine of the application and makes it more vulnerable to attackers. Consider using a custom favicon instead - plus, your users will memorize your application more easily.
